 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;$&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;(0.43&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td nowrap=nowrap style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;&gt;)&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;Options to purchase &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;1,495,380&lt;/div&gt; and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;1,428,272&lt;/div&gt; shares of Common Stock at a weighted average exercise price of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$13.80&lt;/div&gt; and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$13.58&lt;/div&gt; per share were outstanding during fiscal years ended &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018 &lt;/div&gt;and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 28, 2017, &lt;/div&gt;respectively, but were &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; included in the computation of diluted net income per share because the options&amp;#x2019; exercise price were greater than the average market price of the Common Stock and, therefore, their inclusion would be antidilutive.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company uses fair value measurement accounting for financial assets and liabilities and for financial instruments and certain other items measured at fair value. The Company has elected the fair value option for its investment in a non-public company. See Note &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;3&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x2013; Investment in Non-public Company for further information. The Company has &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; elected the fair value option for any of its other eligible financial assets or liabilities.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The accounting guidance established a &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;three&lt;/div&gt;-tier hierarchy for fair value measurements, which prioritizes the inputs used in measuring fair value as follows:&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=;font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt; min-width: 700px;&gt; &lt;tr style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;td style=width: 36pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 45pt; vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;margin-right:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;font-size:10pt;&gt;Level &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;1&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x2013;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;margin-right:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;font-size:10pt;&gt;observable inputs such as quoted prices for identical instruments in active markets.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:81pt;margin-right:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-45pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=;font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt; min-width: 700px;&gt; &lt;tr style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;td style=width: 36pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 45pt; vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;margin-right:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;font-size:10pt;&gt;Level &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x2013;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;margin-right:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;font-size:10pt;&gt;inputs other than quoted prices in active markets that are observable either directly or indirectly through corroboration with observable market data.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:81pt;margin-right:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-45pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=;font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt; min-width: 700px;&gt; &lt;tr style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;td style=width: 36pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 45pt; vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;margin-right:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;font-size:10pt;&gt;Level &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;3&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x2013;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;margin-right:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;font-size:10pt;&gt;unobservable inputs in which there is little or &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;no&lt;/div&gt; market data, which would require the Company to develop its own assumptions.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;As of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the Company held certain assets and liabilities that were required to be measured at fair value on a recurring basis, including its interest rate swap, its minority interest investment in Windset, and its contingent consideration liability from the purchase of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;O&lt;/div&gt;.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: 'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The fair value of the Company&amp;#x2019;s interest rate swap is determined based on model inputs that can be observed in a liquid market, including yield curves, and is categorized as a Level &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2&lt;/div&gt; fair value measurement and is included in other assets in the accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheets.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company has elected the fair value option of accounting for its investment in Windset. The calculation of fair value utilizes significant unobservable inputs, including projected cash flows, growth rates, and discount rates. As a result, the Company&amp;#x2019;s investment in Windset is considered to be a Level &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;3&lt;/div&gt; fair value measurement. The change in the fair value of the Company&amp;#x2019;s investment in Windset for the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;twelve&lt;/div&gt; months ended &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018 &lt;/div&gt;was due to the Company&amp;#x2019;s &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;26.9%&lt;/div&gt; minority interest in the change in the fair market value of Windset during the period. In determining the fair value of the investment in Windset, the Company utilizes the following significant unobservable inputs in the discounted cash flow models:&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=; font-size: 10pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; text-indent: 0px; min-width: 700px;&gt; &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 66%;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 1%;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: right; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 Times

 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;&gt;Discount rates&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;%&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The revenue growth, expense growth, and income tax rate assumptions are considered the Company's best estimate of the trends in those items over the discount period. The discount rate assumption takes into account the risk-free rate of return, the market equity risk premium, and the company&amp;#x2019;s specific risk premium and then applies an additional discount for lack of liquidity of the underlying securities.&amp;nbsp;The discounted cash flow valuation model used by the Company has the following sensitivity to changes in inputs and assumptions (in thousands):&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times

 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;(4,300&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td nowrap=nowrap style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;)&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;Imprecision in estimating unobservable market inputs can affect the amount of gain or loss recorded for a particular position. The use of different methodologies or assumptions to determine the fair value of certain financial instruments could result in a different estimate of fair value at the reporting date.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;The fair value of the Company&amp;#x2019;s contingent consideration liability from its purchase of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;O&lt;/div&gt; (see Note &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x2013; Acquisition of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;O&lt;/div&gt; for further information) is determined by utilizing significant unobservable inputs including projected earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (&amp;#x201c;EBITDA&amp;#x201d;), growth rates and discount rates. As a result, the Company&amp;#x2019;s contingent consideration liability is categorized as a Level &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;3&lt;/div&gt; fair value measurement. In determining the fair value of the contingent consideration liability, the Company assumed EBITDA for &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;O&lt;/div&gt; would be approximately &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$6.4&lt;/div&gt; million over the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;3&lt;/div&gt;-year earn-out period and applying a discount rate of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;22.4%.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The following table summarizes the fair value of the Company&amp;#x2019;s assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value on a recurring basis (in thousands):&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'

&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Financial Instruments&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company&amp;#x2019;s financial instruments are primarily composed of commercial-term trade payables, grower advances, notes receivable, debt instruments and derivative instruments. For short-term instruments, the historical carrying amount approximates the fair value of the instrument. The fair value of long-term debt and lines of credit approximates their carrying value.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Cash Flow Hedges&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company entered into an interest rate swap agreement to manage interest rate risk. This derivative instrument &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;offset a portion of the changes in interest expense. The Company designates this derivative instrument as a cash flow hedge. The Company accounts for its derivative instrument as either an asset or a liability and carries it at fair value in Other assets or Other non-current liabilities. The accounting for changes in the fair value of the derivative instrument depends on the intended use of the derivative instrument and the resulting designation.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: 'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;For derivative instruments that hedge the exposure to variability in expected future cash flows that are designated as cash flow hedges, the effective portion of the gain or loss on the derivative instrument is reported as a component of Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (&amp;#x201c;AOCI&amp;#x201d;) in Stockholders&amp;#x2019; Equity and reclassified into earnings in the same period or periods during which the hedged transaction affects earnings. The ineffective portion of the gain or loss on the derivative instrument, if any, is recognized in earnings in the current period. To receive hedge accounting treatment, cash flow hedges must be highly effective in offsetting changes to expected future cash flows on hedged transactions.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;Comprehensive income consists of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;two&lt;/div&gt; components, net income and Other Comprehensive Income (&amp;#x201c;OCI&amp;#x201d;). OCI refers to revenue, expenses, and gains and losses that under GAAP are recorded as a component of stockholders&amp;#x2019; equity but are excluded from net income. The Company&amp;#x2019;s OCI consists of net deferred gains and losses on its interest rate swap derivative instrument accounted for as a cash flow hedge. The components of AOCI, net of tax, are as follows (in thousands):&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=margin-right: 10%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; text-indent: 0px; min-width: 700px;&gt; &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: right; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Long-Lived Assets&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;The Company&amp;#x2019;s Long-Lived Assets consist of property, plant and equipment, and intangible assets. Intangible assets are comprised of customer relationships with an estimated useful life of &amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;eleven&lt;/div&gt; to &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;thirteen&lt;/div&gt; years (the &amp;#x201c;finite-lived intangible assets&amp;#x201d;) and trademarks/trade names and goodwill with indefinite lives (collectively, &amp;#x201c;the indefinite-lived intangible assets&amp;#x201d;), which the Company recognized (i) upon the acquisition of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;O&lt;/div&gt; in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; March 2017, (&lt;/div&gt;ii) upon the acquisition of GreenLine Holding Company (&amp;#x201c;GreenLine&amp;#x201d;) by Apio in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; April 2012, (&lt;/div&gt;iii) upon the acquisition of Lifecore in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; April 2010 &lt;/div&gt;and (iv) upon the acquisition of Apio in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 1999. &lt;/div&gt;Accounting guidance defines goodwill as &amp;#x201c;the excess of the cost of an acquired entity over the net of the estimated fair values of the assets acquired and the liabilities assumed at date of acquisition.&amp;#x201d; All intangible assets, including goodwill, associated with the acquisition of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;O&lt;/div&gt; was allocated to the Other reporting unit, the acquisition of Lifecore was allocated to the Biomaterials reporting unit, and the acquisitions of Apio and GreenLine were allocated to the Packaged Fresh Vegetables reporting unit based&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt; &lt;/div&gt;upon the allocation of assets and liabilities acquired and consideration paid for each reporting unit. As of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the Other reporting unit had &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$5.2&lt;/div&gt; million of goodwill, the Biomaterials reporting unit had &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$13.9&lt;/div&gt; million of goodwill, and the Packaged Fresh Vegetables reporting unit had &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$35.4&lt;/div&gt; million of goodwill.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: 'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;Property, plant and equipment and finite-lived intangible assets are reviewed for possible impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances occur that indicate that the carrying amount of an asset (or asset group) &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; be recoverable. The Company&amp;#x2019;s impairment review requires significant management judgment including estimating the future success of product lines, future sales volumes, revenue and expense growth rates, alternative uses for the assets and estimated proceeds from the disposal of the assets. The Company conducts quarterly reviews of idle and underutilized equipment, and reviews business plans for possible impairment indicators. Impairment is indicated when the carrying amount of the asset (or asset group) exceeds its estimated future undiscounted cash flows and the impairment is viewed as other than temporary. When impairment is indicated, an impairment charge is recorded for the difference between the asset&amp;#x2019;s book value and its estimated fair value. Depending on the asset, estimated fair value &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;be determined either by use of a discounted cash flow model or by reference to estimated selling values of assets in similar condition. The use of different assumptions would increase or decrease the estimated fair value of assets and would increase or decrease any impairment measurement.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company tests its indefinite-lived intangible assets for impairment at least annually, in accordance with accounting guidance. For all indefinite-lived assets, including goodwill, the Company performs a qualitative analysis in accordance with ASC &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;350&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;30&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;35.&lt;/div&gt; Application of the impairment tests for indefinite-lived intangible assets requires significant judgment by management, including identification of reporting units, assignment of assets and liabilities to reporting units, assignment of intangible assets to reporting units, which judgments are inherently uncertain.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;During fiscal years &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt; and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017,&lt;/div&gt; there were &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;no&lt;/div&gt; impairments of intangible assets.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;On a quarterly basis, the Company considers the need to update its most recent annual tests for possible impairment of its indefinite-lived intangible assets, based on management&amp;#x2019;s assessment of changes in its business and other economic factors since the most recent annual evaluation. Such changes, if significant or material, could indicate a need to update the most recent annual tests for impairment of the indefinite-lived intangible assets during the current period. The results of these tests could lead to write-downs of the carrying values of these assets in the current period.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;In the annual impairment test, the Company assesses qualitative factors to determine whether it is necessary to perform the quantitative goodwill impairment test. In assessing the qualitative factors, management considers the impact of these key factors: macro-economic conditions, industry and market environment, cost factors, overall financial performance of the Company, cash flow from operating activities, market capitalization, litigation, and stock price. If management determines as a result of the qualitative assessment that it is more likely than &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; (that is, a likelihood of more than &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;50&lt;/div&gt; percent) that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying amount, then the quantitative test is required. Otherwise, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;no&lt;/div&gt; further testing is required.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;If a quantitative test is required, the Company would compare the carrying amount of a reporting unit that includes goodwill to its fair value. The Company determines the fair value using both an income approach and a market approach. Under the income approach, fair value is determined based on estimated future cash flows, discounted by an estimated weighted-average cost of capital, which reflects the overall level of inherent risk of the Company and the rate of return an outside investor would expect to earn. Under the market-based approach, information regarding the Company is utilized as well as publicly available industry information to determine earnings multiples that are used to value the Company. A goodwill impairment loss is recognized for the amount that the carrying amount of a reporting unit, including goodwill, exceeds its fair value, limited to the total amount of goodwill allocated to that reporting unit.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;8.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;U.S Tax Reform Impact&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;On &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 22, 2017, &lt;/div&gt;the U.S. Government enacted the reconciled tax reform bill, commonly known as the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt; (the &amp;#x201c;TCJA&amp;#x201d;), which became effective on &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; January 1, 2018. &lt;/div&gt;The TCJA makes broad changes to the U.S. tax code including, but &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; limited to, reducing the Company&amp;#x2019;s federal statutory tax rate from &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;35%,&lt;/div&gt; to an average rate of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;29.35%&lt;/div&gt; for the fiscal year ended &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;and then &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;21%&lt;/div&gt; for fiscal years thereafter; requiring companies to pay a &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;one&lt;/div&gt;-time transition tax on certain unrepatriated earnings of foreign subsidiaries; generally eliminating U.S. federal income taxes on dividends from foreign subsidiaries; requiring a current inclusion in U.S. federal taxable income of certain earnings of controlled foreign corporations' creating a global intangibles low-taxed income inclusion (GILTI) and the base erosion anti-abuse tax (BEAT), a new minimum tax. The TCJA also enhances and extends through &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2026&lt;/div&gt; the option to claim accelerated depreciation deductions on qualified property&amp;#x37e; however, the domestic manufacturing deduction, from which the Company has historically benefitted, has been eliminated.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;On &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 22, 2017, &lt;/div&gt;SAB &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;118&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;was issued to address the application of GAAP in situations when a registrant does &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; have the necessary information available, prepared, or analyzed in reasonable detail to complete its accounting for certain income tax effects of the TCJA. Pursuant to SAB &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;118,&lt;/div&gt; as of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the Company had &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; yet completed its accounting for the tax effects of the enactment of the TCJA. The Company&amp;#x2019;s provision for income taxes for the year ended &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018 &lt;/div&gt;is based in part on its best estimate of the effects of the transition tax and existing deferred tax balances with its understanding of the TCJA and guidance available as of the date of this filing. For the amounts which were reasonably estimable, we recognized a provisional remeasurement of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$16.2&lt;/div&gt; million of certain deferred tax assets and liabilities based on the rates at which they are expected to reverse in the future. The provisional amount related to the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;one&lt;/div&gt;-time transition tax on the mandatory deemed repatriation of foreign earnings was an expense of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.8&lt;/div&gt; million. We are still analyzing certain aspects of the TCJA and refining the estimate of the expected reversal of our deferred tax balance. This can potentially affect the measurement of these balances or potentially give rise to new deferred tax amounts.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The (benefit) provision for income taxes from continuing operations consisted of the following (in thousands):&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div&gt; &lt;table style=; font-size: 10pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; text-indent: 0px; min-width: 700px; cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 border=0&gt;  &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom;&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;&gt;Year Ended&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom;&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;&gt;May 27, 2018&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;&gt;May 29, 2016&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204

 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;&gt;Current:&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; text-indent: 9pt;&gt;Federal&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;$&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;(2,854&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; nowrap=nowrap&gt;)&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;$&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;1,388&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times

 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The decrease in the income tax expense for fiscal year &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt; was primarily due to the TCJA such as the statutory rate change for federal and state, and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;one&lt;/div&gt;-time transition tax on the repatriation of foreign earnings. Additionally, the effective tax rate for fiscal year &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt; decreased from expense of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;29%&lt;/div&gt; to a benefit of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;64%&lt;/div&gt; in comparison to fiscal year &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times

 255);&gt; &lt;td&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204

 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;&gt;Net deferred tax liabilities&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 0);&gt;$&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0
 0
 0);&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;(17,485&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; padding-bottom: 3px; nowrap=nowrap&gt;)&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0
 0
 0);&gt;$&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0
 0
 0);&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;(24,581&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; padding-bottom: 3px; nowrap=nowrap&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;&gt;)&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt;  &lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The effective tax rates for fiscal year &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt; differ from the blended statutory federal income tax rate of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;29.35%&lt;/div&gt; as a result of several factors, including change in ending federal and state deferred blended rate, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;one&lt;/div&gt;-time transition tax due to the repatriation of foreign earnings, the change in valuation allowance, limitation of deductibility of executive compensation, and the benefit of federal and state research and development credits. The effective tax rates for fiscal year &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt; differ from the statutory federal income tax rate of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;35%&lt;/div&gt; as a result of several factors, including non-deductible stock-based compensation expense, disqualified dispositions of incentive stock options, excess equity compensation benefits from the adoption of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09,&lt;/div&gt; domestic manufacturing deduction, the benefit of federal and state research and development credits, the change in valuation allowance, all of which is partially offset by state taxes. The effective tax rates for fiscal year &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt; differ from the statutory federal income tax rate of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;35%&lt;/div&gt; as a result of several factors, including state taxes, non-deductible stock-based compensation expense, disqualified dispositions of incentive stock options, domestic manufacturing deduction, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;162m&lt;/div&gt; limitation, the benefit of federal and state research and development credits and the change in valuation allowance.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: 'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:37.5pt;&gt;During&amp;nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;fiscal year ended&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2018,&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;excess&amp;nbsp;tax&amp;nbsp;deficits&amp;nbsp;related&amp;nbsp;to&amp;nbsp;stock-based&amp;nbsp;compensation&amp;nbsp;of&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$38,000&lt;/div&gt; were&amp;nbsp;reflected&amp;nbsp;in&amp;nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;consolidated statements of&amp;nbsp;income (loss) as&amp;nbsp;a&amp;nbsp;component&amp;nbsp;of&amp;nbsp;income tax&amp;nbsp;expense&amp;nbsp;as&amp;nbsp;a result&amp;nbsp;of&amp;nbsp;the adoption of&amp;nbsp;ASU&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09,&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;specifically related to&amp;nbsp;the prospective&amp;nbsp;application&amp;nbsp;of excess tax&amp;nbsp;deficits&amp;nbsp;and tax deficiencies&amp;nbsp;related to stock-based&amp;nbsp;compensation.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:45pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company elected to early adopt the new guidance of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09,&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Compensation &amp;#x2013; Stock Compensation (Topic &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;718&lt;/div&gt;)&lt;/div&gt;:&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt; Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payments Accounting&lt;/div&gt;, in the quarter beginning &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 30, 2016. &lt;/div&gt;Accordingly the primary effects of the adoption are as follows: (&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;1&lt;/div&gt;) using a modified retrospective application, the Company recorded unrecognized excess tax benefits of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$549,000&lt;/div&gt; as a cumulative-effect adjustment, which increased retained earnings, and reduced deferred taxes by the same, (&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2&lt;/div&gt;) using a modified retrospective application, the Company has elected to recognize forfeitures as they occur and recorded a &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$200,000&lt;/div&gt; increase to additional paid in capital, a &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$126,000&lt;/div&gt; reduction to retained earnings, and a &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$74,000&lt;/div&gt; reduction to deferred taxes to reflect the incremental stock-based compensation expense, net of the related tax impacts, that would have been recognized in prior years under the modified guidance, and (&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;3&lt;/div&gt;) &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$150,000&lt;/div&gt; and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$463,000&lt;/div&gt; in excess tax benefits from stock-based compensation was reclassified from cash flows from financing activities to cash flows from operating activities for the fiscal years ended &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 29, 2016 &lt;/div&gt;and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 31, 2015, &lt;/div&gt;respectively, in the Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:45pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;As of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the Company had federal, Indiana, and other state net operating loss carryforwards of approximately &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$7.1&lt;/div&gt; million, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$5.6&lt;/div&gt; million, and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$3.1&lt;/div&gt; million, respectively. These losses expire in different periods through &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2032,&lt;/div&gt; if &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; utilized. The Company acquired additional net operating losses through the acquisition of GreenLine. Utilization of these acquired net operating losses in a specific year is limited due to the &amp;#x201c;change in ownership&amp;#x201d; provision of the Internal Revenue Code of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;1986&lt;/div&gt; and similar state provisions. The net operating losses presented above for federal and state purposes are net of any such limitation.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:65.1%;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company has federal,&amp;nbsp;California, and Minnesota research and development tax credit carryforwards of approximately &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$0.4&lt;/div&gt; million, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.5&lt;/div&gt; million, and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$0.7&lt;/div&gt; million, respectively. The research and development tax credit carryforwards have an unlimited carryforward period for state purposes and a &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;20&lt;/div&gt;-year carryforward for federal purposes.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:45pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;Valuation allowances are reviewed each period on a tax jurisdiction by jurisdiction basis to analyze whether there is sufficient positive or negative evidence to support a change in judgment about the realizability of the related deferred tax assets. Based on this analysis and considering all positive and negative evidence, the Company determined that a valuation allowance of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.3&lt;/div&gt; million should be recorded as a result of uncertainty around the utilization of certain state net operating losses and a book impairment loss on the Company's investment in Aesthetic Sciences as it is more likely than &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; that a portion of the deferred tax asset will &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; be realized in the foreseeable future. The valuation allowance increased by an immaterial amount from the prior year primarily due to uncertainty around the utilization of certain state net operating losses and credits.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:45pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an enterprise&amp;#x2019;s financial statements prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return, and the derecognition of tax benefits, classification on the balance sheet, interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure, and transition.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;A reconciliation of the beginning and ending amount of unrecognized tax benefits is as follows (in thousands):&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'

 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0
 0
 0);&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;842&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 3px; margin-left: 0pt; nowrap=nowrap&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt;  &lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: 'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;As of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the total amount of net unrecognized tax benefits is &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$479,000,&lt;/div&gt; of which, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$372,000,&lt;/div&gt; if recognized, would change the effective tax rate. The Company accrues interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in its provision for income taxes. The total amount of penalties and interest is &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; material as of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018. &lt;/div&gt;Additionally, the Company expects its unrecognized tax benefits to decrease by approximately &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$25,000&lt;/div&gt; within the next &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;12&lt;/div&gt; months.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company accounts for income taxes in accordance with accounting guidance which requires that deferred tax assets and liabilities be recognized using enacted tax rates for the effect of temporary differences between the book and tax basis of recorded assets and liabilities. The Company maintains valuation allowances when it is likely that all or a portion of a deferred tax asset will &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; be realized. Changes in valuation allowances from period to period are included in the Company&amp;#x2019;s income tax provision in the period of change. In determining whether a valuation allowance is warranted, the Company takes into account such factors as prior earnings history, expected future earnings, unsettled circumstances that, if unfavorably resolved, would adversely affect utilization of a deferred tax asset, carryback and carryforward periods, and tax strategies that could potentially enhance the likelihood of realization of a deferred tax asset. At &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the Company had a &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.3&lt;/div&gt; million valuation allowance against its deferred tax assets.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= background-color:#FFFFFF;font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;In addition to valuation allowances, the Company establishes accruals for uncertain tax positions. The tax-contingency accruals are adjusted in light of changing facts and circumstances, such as the progress of tax audits, case law and emerging legislation. The Company recognizes interest and penalties related to uncertain tax positions as a component of income tax expense. The Company&amp;#x2019;s effective tax rate includes the impact of tax-contingency accruals as considered appropriate by management.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= background-color:#FFFFFF;font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= background-color: rgb(255
 255
 255); font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= background-color:#FFFFFF;font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Inventories&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;Inventories are stated at the lower of cost (using the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;first&lt;/div&gt;-in, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;first&lt;/div&gt;-out method) or net realizable value. As of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018 &lt;/div&gt;and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 28, 2017 &lt;/div&gt;inventories consisted of (in thousands):&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
