 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0
 0
 0);&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;23,620&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td nowrap=nowrap style=width: 1%; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 3px; margin-left: 0pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;3.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Investment&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt; in Non-public C&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;ompan&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;y&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Windset&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;On &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; February 15, 2011,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;Apio entered into a share&amp;nbsp;purchase agreement (the &amp;#x201c;Windset Purchase Agreement&amp;#x201d;)&amp;nbsp;with Windset. Pursuant to the Windset Purchase Agreement, Apio purchased from Windset &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;150,000&lt;/div&gt; Senior A preferred shares for &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$15&lt;/div&gt; million and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;201&lt;/div&gt; common shares for &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$201.&lt;/div&gt; On &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; July 15, 2014, &lt;/div&gt;Apio increased its investment in Windset by purchasing from the Newell Capital Corporation an additional &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;68&lt;/div&gt; common shares and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;51,211&lt;/div&gt; junior preferred shares of Windset for &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$11&lt;/div&gt; million. After this purchase, the Company&amp;#x2019;s common shares represent a &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;26.9%&lt;/div&gt; ownership interest in Windset. The Senior A preferred&amp;nbsp;shares yield a cash dividend of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;7.5%&lt;/div&gt; annually. The dividend is payable within &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;90&lt;/div&gt; days of each anniversary of the execution of the Windset Purchase Agreement. The non-voting junior preferred stock does &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; yield a dividend unless declared by the Board of Directors of Windset and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;no&lt;/div&gt; such dividend has been declared. Under the terms of the arrangement with Windset, the Company is entitled to designate &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;one&lt;/div&gt; of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;five&lt;/div&gt; members on the Board of Directors of Windset.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;On &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; October 29, 2014, &lt;/div&gt;Apio further increased its investment in Windset by purchasing &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;70,000&lt;/div&gt; shares of Senior B preferred shares for &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$7&lt;/div&gt; million. The Senior B preferred shares pay an annual dividend of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;7.5%&lt;/div&gt; on the amount outstanding at each anniversary date of the Windset Purchase Agreement. The Senior B preferred shares purchased by Apio have a put feature whereby Apio can sell back to Windset &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.5&lt;/div&gt; million of shares on the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;first&lt;/div&gt; anniversary, an additional &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$2.75&lt;/div&gt; million of shares on the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;second&lt;/div&gt; anniversary, and the remaining &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$2.75&lt;/div&gt; million on the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;third&lt;/div&gt; anniversary. After the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;third&lt;/div&gt; anniversary, Apio &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;at any time put any or all of the shares &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; previously sold back to Windset.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The original Shareholders&amp;#x2019; Agreement between Apio and Windset included a put and call option (the &amp;#x201c;Put and Call Option&amp;#x201d;), which could be exercised on or after &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; February 15, 2017 &lt;/div&gt;whereby Apio could have exercised the put to sell its common, Senior A preferred shares, and junior preferred shares to Windset, or Windset could have exercised the call to purchase those shares from Apio, in either case, at a price equal to &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;26.9%&lt;/div&gt; of the fair market value of Windset&amp;#x2019;s common shares, plus the liquidation value of the preferred shares of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$20.1&lt;/div&gt; million (&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$15&lt;/div&gt; million for the Senior A preferred shares and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$5.1&lt;/div&gt; million for the junior preferred shares). On &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; March 15, 2017, &lt;/div&gt;the Company and Windset amended the Shareholders&amp;#x2019; Agreement by extending the terms of the original Put and Call Option to &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; March 31, 2022.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The investment in Windset does &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; qualify for equity method accounting as the investment does &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; meet the criteria of in-substance common stock due to returns through the annual dividend on the non-voting senior preferred shares that are &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; available to the common stock holders. As the Put and Call option requires all of the various shares to be put or called in equal proportions, the Company has deemed that the investment, in substance, should be treated as a single security for purposes of accounting.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The fair value of the Company&amp;#x2019;s investment in Windset was determined utilizing the Windset Purchase Agreement&amp;#x2019;s Put and Call Option calculation for value and a discounted cash flow model based on projections developed by Windset, and considers the put and call conversion options. These features impact the duration of the cash flows utilized to derive the estimated fair values of the investment. These &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;two&lt;/div&gt; discounted cash flow models are then weighted. Assumptions included in these discounted cash flow models will be evaluated quarterly based on Windset&amp;#x2019;s actual and projected operating results to determine the change in fair value.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company recorded &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.7&lt;/div&gt; million, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.7&lt;/div&gt; million and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.7&lt;/div&gt; million in dividend income for the fiscal years ended &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 28, 2017 &lt;/div&gt;and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 29, 2016, &lt;/div&gt;respectively. The increase in the fair market value of the Company&amp;#x2019;s investment in Windset for the fiscal years ended &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 28, 2017 &lt;/div&gt;and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 29, 2016 &lt;/div&gt;was &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$2.9&lt;/div&gt; million, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$900,000&lt;/div&gt; and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.2&lt;/div&gt; million, respectively, and is included in other income in the accompanying Consolidated Statements of Income (Loss).&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= background-color:#FFFFFF;font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The Company also entered into an exclusive license agreement with Windset, which was executed in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; June 2010, &lt;/div&gt;prior to contemplation of Apio&amp;#x2019;s investment in Windset.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; text-decoration: underline;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Recently Adopted Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;On &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 22, 2017, &lt;/div&gt;Staff Accounting Bulletin &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;118&lt;/div&gt; (&amp;#x201c;SAB &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;118&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;) was issued to address the application of GAAP in situations when a registrant does &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; have the necessary information available, prepared, or analyzed in reasonable detail to complete its accounting for certain income tax effects of the TCJA. Pursuant to SAB &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;118,&lt;/div&gt; as of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the Company had &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; yet completed its accounting for the tax effects of the enactment of the TCJA. The Company&amp;#x2019;s provision for income taxes for the year ended &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27, 2018 &lt;/div&gt;is based in part on its best estimate of the effects of the transition tax and existing deferred tax balances with its understanding of the TCJA and guidance available as of the date of this filing. The Company is still analyzing certain aspects of the TCJA and refining the estimate of the expected reversal of our deferred tax balance. This can potentially affect the measurement of these balances or potentially give rise to new deferred tax amounts. The Company adopted the provisions of SAB &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;118&lt;/div&gt; in the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;third&lt;/div&gt; quarter of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2018.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Recently Issued Pronouncements to be Adopted&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;In &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014,&lt;/div&gt; the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#x201c;FASB&amp;#x201d;) issued ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09,&lt;/div&gt; which creates FASB ASC Topic &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;606&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;, Revenue from Contracts with Customers&lt;/div&gt; and supersedes ASC Topic &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;605,&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/div&gt; (&amp;#x201c;ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;). The guidance replaces industry-specific guidance and establishes a single &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;five&lt;/div&gt;-step model to identify and recognize revenue. The core principle of the guidance is that an entity should recognize revenue upon transfer of control of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which an entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. Additionally, the guidance requires the entity to disclose further quantitative and qualitative information regarding the nature and amount of revenues arising from contracts with customers, as well as other information about the significant judgments and estimates used in recognizing revenues from contracts with customers. &amp;nbsp;Since its original issuance, the FASB has issued several additional related ASUs to address implementation concerns and to further clarify certain guidance within ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09.&lt;/div&gt; The Company will adopt these updates beginning with the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;first&lt;/div&gt; quarter of fiscal year &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2019&lt;/div&gt; and anticipates doing so using the modified retrospective method, which would require a cumulative effect adjustment of initially applying ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09&lt;/div&gt; recognized at the date or initial application.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;The Company recently completed its evaluation of the impact of the adoption of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09.&lt;/div&gt; As a result, the Company has identified the following core revenue streams from its contracts with customers:&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 15pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=; text-indent: 0px; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; min-width: 700px;&gt; &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;td style=width: 36pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 18pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;#x25cf;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;Finished goods product sales (Packaged Fresh Vegetables);&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=; text-indent: 0px; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; min-width: 700px;&gt; &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;td style=width: 36pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 18pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;#x25cf;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;Shipping and handling (Packaged Fresh Vegetables);&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=; text-indent: 0px; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; min-width: 700px;&gt; &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;td style=width: 36pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 18pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;#x25cf;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;Product development and contract manufacturing arrangements (Biomaterials).&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 15pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;The Company&amp;#x2019;s assessment efforts have included reviewing current accounting policies, processes, and systems requirements, as well assigning internal resources and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;third&lt;/div&gt;-party consultants to assist in the process. Based upon the Company&amp;#x2019;s assessment, certain contract manufacturing arrangements within its Biomaterials segment contain termination provisions that, upon final assessment and adoption, &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;impact the timing of revenue recognition. Additionally, the Company has reviewed historical contracts and other arrangements to identify potential differences that could arise from the adoption of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09.&lt;/div&gt; Beyond its core revenue streams, and the items listed above, the Company has also evaluated the impact of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09&lt;/div&gt; on certain ancillary transactions and other arrangements.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 15pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;As a result of its assessment efforts, the Company does &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; currently anticipate any material changes to its processes, financial condition, or results of operations upon adoption of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09.&lt;/div&gt; The Company continues to assess the impact of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09,&lt;/div&gt; along with industry trends and additional interpretive guidance, on its core revenue streams, and as a result of the continued assessment, the Company &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;modify its plan to adoption accordingly.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 15pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Leases&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;In &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; February 2016, &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02,&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Leases (Topic &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;842&lt;/div&gt;) &lt;/div&gt;(&amp;#x201c;ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;), which requires companies to generally recognize on the balance sheet operating and financing lease liabilities and corresponding right-of-use-assets. ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02&lt;/div&gt; also requires improved disclosures to help users of financial statements better understand the amount, timing and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. &amp;nbsp;The Company will adopt ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02&lt;/div&gt; beginning in the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;first&lt;/div&gt; quarter of fiscal year &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2020&lt;/div&gt; on a modified retrospective basis.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;The Company is currently in the process of evaluating the impact that ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02&lt;/div&gt; will have upon its consolidated financial statements and related disclosures. The Company&amp;#x2019;s assessment efforts to date have included:&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=; text-indent: 0px; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; min-width: 700px;&gt; &lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;td style=width: 36pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=width: 18pt; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;&amp;#x25cf;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td style=font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt; &lt;div style= margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;Reviewing the provisions of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=; text-indent: 0px; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times

 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;Gathering information to evaluate its lease population and portfolio;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=; text-indent: 0px; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;Evaluating the nature of its real and personal property and other arrangements that &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;meet the definition of a lease; and&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;table border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=; text-indent: 0px; font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;

 serif; font-size: 10pt;&gt;Systems&amp;#x2019; readiness evaluations.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'

 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;As a result of these efforts, the Company currently anticipates that the adoption of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02&lt;/div&gt; will have a significant impact on its long-term assets and liabilities, as, at a minimum, virtually all of its leases designated as operating leases in Note &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;9&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x2013; Commitments and Contingencies, are expected to be reported on the consolidated balance sheets. The pattern of recognition for operating leases within the consolidated statements of comprehensive income is &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; anticipated to significantly change. This change will have &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;no&lt;/div&gt; impact on the Company&amp;#x2019;s ability to meet its loan covenants as the impact from the adoption of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02&lt;/div&gt; was taken into consideration when determining its loan covenants.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: 'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;In &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; February 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02,&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Reclassification of Certain Tax Effects from Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income &lt;/div&gt;that permits a reclassification from accumulated other comprehensive income to retained earnings for stranded tax effects resulting from the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act enacted in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 2017. &lt;/div&gt;The standard is effective for fiscal years beginning after &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 15, 2018. &lt;/div&gt;Early adoption is permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the impact that the adoption of this guidance will have on its consolidated financial statements.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Hedging&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;In &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; August 2017, &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;12,&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Targeted Improvements to Accounting for Hedging Activities&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;(ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;12&lt;/div&gt;), which amends the presentation and disclosure requirements and changes how companies assess effectiveness. The amendments are intended to more closely align hedge accounting with companies&amp;#x2019; risk management strategies, simplify the application of hedge accounting, and increase transparency as to the scope and results of hedging programs. ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;12&lt;/div&gt; is effective for annual periods beginning after &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 15, 2018, &lt;/div&gt;including interim periods within those periods. Early application is permitted. The Company is currently assessing the future impact of this update on its consolidated financial statements and related disclosures.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Financial Instruments &amp;#x2013; Credit Losses&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
&lt;div style=display: inline; font-family: times new roman; font-size: 10pt&gt;&lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;1.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Organization, Basis of Presentation, and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Organization&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;
 Times
 serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 36pt;&gt;Landec Corporation and its subsidiaries (&amp;#x201c;Landec&amp;#x201d; or the &amp;#x201c;Company&amp;#x201d;) design, develop, manufacture, and sell differentiated health and wellness products for food and biomaterials markets, and license technology applications to partners. The Company has &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;two&lt;/div&gt; proprietary polymer technology platforms: &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;1&lt;/div&gt;) Intelimer&amp;reg; polymers, and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2&lt;/div&gt;) hyaluronan (&amp;#x201c;HA&amp;#x201d;) biopolymers. The Company sells specialty packaged branded Eat Smart&amp;reg; and GreenLine&amp;reg; and private label fresh-cut vegetables and whole produce to retailers, club stores, and foodservice operators, primarily in the United States, Canada, and Asia through its Apio, Inc. (&amp;#x201c;Apio&amp;#x201d;) subsidiary, and sells HA-based and non-HA biomaterials through its Lifecore Biomedical, Inc. (&amp;#x201c;Lifecore&amp;#x201d;) subsidiary. The Company&amp;#x2019;s HA biopolymers and non-HA materials are proprietary in that they are specially formulated for specific customers to meet strict regulatory requirements. The Company also sells specialty olive oils and wine vinegars in the natural food, conventional grocery and mass retail stores primarily in the United States and Canada through its O Olive and Vinegar&amp;reg; brand. The Company&amp;#x2019;s technologies, along with its customer relationships and trade names, are the foundation, and a key differentiating advantage upon which Landec has built its business.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.5pt;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt;Basis of Presentation&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt; and Consolidation&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;The consolidated financial statements are presented on the accrual basis of accounting in accordance with U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (&amp;#x201c;GAAP&amp;#x201d;) and include the accounts of Landec Corporation and its subsidiaries, Apio and Lifecore. All material inter-company transactions and balances have been eliminated.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style= font-family:'Times New Roman'
 Times
 serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt;&gt;In &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 2018, &lt;/div&gt;the Company discontinued the Food Export business segment. As a result, the Food Export business segment was reclassified as a discontinued operation under the provisions of Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;205&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;20,&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Presentation of Financial Statements - Discontinued Operations&lt;/div&gt; (ASC &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;205&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;20&lt;/div&gt;) and ASC &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;360,&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Property, Plant and Equipment&lt;/div&gt; (ASC &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;360&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;).  and there is &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;no&lt;/div&gt; continuing involvement by the Company

 the Company splits the arrangement into separate units of accounting if the individually delivered elements have value to the customer on a standalone basis. The Company also evaluates whether multiple transactions with the same customer or related party should be considered part of a multiple element arrangement
 whereby the Company assesses
 among other factors
 whether the contracts or agreements are negotiated or executed within a short time frame of each other or if there are indicators that the contracts are negotiated in contemplation of each other. The Company then allocates revenue to each element based on a selling price hierarchy. The relative selling price for a deliverable is based on its vendor-specific objective evidence (&amp;#x201c;VSOE&amp;#x201d;)
 if available
 &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;third&lt;/div&gt;-party evidence (&amp;#x201c;TPE&amp;#x201d;)
 if VSOE is &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; available
 or estimated selling price
 if neither VSOE nor TPE is available. The Company then recognizes revenue on each deliverable in accordance with its policies for product and service revenue recognition. The Company is &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; typically able to determine VSOE or TPE
 and therefore

 and for an arrangement that includes a general right of return relative to the delivered products or services
 delivery or performance of the undelivered product or service is considered probable and is substantially controlled by the Company. The Company considers a deliverable to have stand-alone value if the product or service is sold separately by the Company or another vendor or could be resold by the customer. Further
 the revenue arrangements generally do &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; include a general right of return relative to delivered products. Where the aforementioned criteria for a separate unit of accounting are &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; met
 the deliverable is combined with the undelivered element(s) and treated as a single unit of accounting for the purposes of allocation of the arrangement consideration and revenue recognition. The Company allocates the total arrangement consideration to each separable element of an arrangement based upon the relative selling price of each element. Allocation of the consideration is determined at arrangement inception on the basis of each unit&amp;#x2019;s relative selling price. In instances where the Company has &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; established fair value for any undelivered element

 the initial license fees are deferred and amortized to revenue over the period of the agreement when a contract exists
 the fee is fixed and determinable
 and collectability is reasonably assured. Noncancellable
 nonrefundable license fees are recognized over the period of the agreement

 the Company offers customers sales incentives

















 cash equivalents











 &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;first&lt;/div&gt;-out method) or net realizable value. As of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27
 2018 &lt;/div&gt;and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 28

 &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$1.9&lt;/div&gt; million and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$2.1&lt;/div&gt; million

 and are reviewed at least quarterly for collectability.  and intangible assets. Intangible assets are comprised of customer relationships with an estimated useful life of &amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;eleven&lt;/div&gt; to &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;thirteen&lt;/div&gt; years (the &amp;#x201c;finite-lived intangible assets&amp;#x201d;) and trademarks/trade names and goodwill with indefinite lives (collectively
 &amp;#x201c;the indefinite-lived intangible assets&amp;#x201d;)
 which the Company recognized (i) upon the acquisition of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;O&lt;/div&gt; in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; March 2017
 (&lt;/div&gt;ii) upon the acquisition of GreenLine Holding Company (&amp;#x201c;GreenLine&amp;#x201d;) by Apio in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; April 2012
 (&lt;/div&gt;iii) upon the acquisition of Lifecore in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; April 2010 &lt;/div&gt;and (iv) upon the acquisition of Apio in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 1999. &lt;/div&gt;Accounting guidance defines goodwill as &amp;#x201c;the excess of the cost of an acquired entity over the net of the estimated fair values of the assets acquired and the liabilities assumed at date of acquisition.&amp;#x201d; All intangible assets
 including goodwill
 associated with the acquisition of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;O&lt;/div&gt; was allocated to the Other reporting unit
 the acquisition of Lifecore was allocated to the Biomaterials reporting unit
 and the acquisitions of Apio and GreenLine were allocated to the Packaged Fresh Vegetables reporting unit based&lt;div style=display: inline; font-weight: bold;&gt; &lt;/div&gt;upon the allocation of assets and liabilities acquired and consideration paid for each reporting unit. As of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27
 2018
 &lt;/div&gt;the Other reporting unit had &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$5.2&lt;/div&gt; million of goodwill
 the Biomaterials reporting unit had &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;$13.9&lt;/div&gt; million of goodwill

 plant and equipment and finite-lived intangible assets are reviewed for possible impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances occur that indicate that the carrying amount of an asset (or asset group) &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; be recoverable. The Company&amp;#x2019;s impairment review requires significant management judgment including estimating the future success of product lines
 future sales volumes
 revenue and expense growth rates
 alternative uses for the assets and estimated proceeds from the disposal of the assets. The Company conducts quarterly reviews of idle and underutilized equipment
 and reviews business plans for possible impairment indicators. Impairment is indicated when the carrying amount of the asset (or asset group) exceeds its estimated future undiscounted cash flows and the impairment is viewed as other than temporary. When impairment is indicated
 an impairment charge is recorded for the difference between the asset&amp;#x2019;s book value and its estimated fair value. Depending on the asset

 in accordance with accounting guidance. For all indefinite-lived assets
 including goodwill
 the Company performs a qualitative analysis in accordance with ASC &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;350&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;30&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;35.&lt;/div&gt; Application of the impairment tests for indefinite-lived intangible assets requires significant judgment by management
 including identification of reporting units
 assignment of assets and liabilities to reporting units
 assignment of intangible assets to reporting units


 the Company considers the need to update its most recent annual tests for possible impairment of its indefinite-lived intangible assets
 based on management&amp;#x2019;s assessment of changes in its business and other economic factors since the most recent annual evaluation. Such changes
 if significant or material

 the Company assesses qualitative factors to determine whether it is necessary to perform the quantitative goodwill impairment test. In assessing the qualitative factors
 management considers the impact of these key factors: macro-economic conditions
 industry and market environment
 cost factors
 overall financial performance of the Company
 cash flow from operating activities
 market capitalization
 litigation
 and stock price. If management determines as a result of the qualitative assessment that it is more likely than &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; (that is
 a likelihood of more than &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;50&lt;/div&gt; percent) that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying amount
 then the quantitative test is required. Otherwise

 the Company would compare the carrying amount of a reporting unit that includes goodwill to its fair value. The Company determines the fair value using both an income approach and a market approach. Under the income approach
 fair value is determined based on estimated future cash flows
 discounted by an estimated weighted-average cost of capital
 which reflects the overall level of inherent risk of the Company and the rate of return an outside investor would expect to earn. Under the market-based approach
 information regarding the Company is utilized as well as publicly available industry information to determine earnings multiples that are used to value the Company. A goodwill impairment loss is recognized for the amount that the carrying amount of a reporting unit
 including goodwill
 exceeds its fair value

 2018
 &lt;/div&gt;the Company tested its goodwill for impairment and determined that &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;no&lt;/div&gt; indication of impairment existed as of that date. As a result
 it was &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; necessary to perform the quantitative goodwill impairment test at that time.  &lt;/div&gt;Staff Accounting Bulletin &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;No.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;118&lt;/div&gt; (&amp;#x201c;SAB &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;118&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;) was issued to address the application of GAAP in situations when a registrant does &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; have the necessary information available
 prepared

&lt;/div&gt; the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#x201c;FASB&amp;#x201d;) issued ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09
&lt;/div&gt; which creates FASB ASC Topic &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;606&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;
 Revenue from Contracts with Customers&lt;/div&gt; and supersedes ASC Topic &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;605
&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/div&gt; (&amp;#x201c;ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;). The guidance replaces industry-specific guidance and establishes a single &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;five&lt;/div&gt;-step model to identify and recognize revenue. The core principle of the guidance is that an entity should recognize revenue upon transfer of control of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which an entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. Additionally
 the guidance requires the entity to disclose further quantitative and qualitative information regarding the nature and amount of revenues arising from contracts with customers
 as well as other information about the significant judgments and estimates used in recognizing revenues from contracts with customers. &amp;nbsp;Since its original issuance
 the FASB has issued several additional related ASUs to address implementation concerns and to further clarify certain guidance within ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09.&lt;/div&gt; The Company will adopt these updates beginning with the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;first&lt;/div&gt; quarter of fiscal year &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2019&lt;/div&gt; and anticipates doing so using the modified retrospective method


 processes
 and systems requirements
 as well assigning internal resources and &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;third&lt;/div&gt;-party consultants to assist in the process. Based upon the Company&amp;#x2019;s assessment
 certain contract manufacturing arrangements within its Biomaterials segment contain termination provisions that
 upon final assessment and adoption
 &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;impact the timing of revenue recognition. Additionally
 the Company has reviewed historical contracts and other arrangements to identify potential differences that could arise from the adoption of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09.&lt;/div&gt; Beyond its core revenue streams
 and the items listed above

 the Company does &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; currently anticipate any material changes to its processes
 financial condition
 or results of operations upon adoption of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09.&lt;/div&gt; The Company continues to assess the impact of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2014&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;09
&lt;/div&gt; along with industry trends and additional interpretive guidance
 on its core revenue streams
 and as a result of the continued assessment

 &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02
&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Leases (Topic &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;842&lt;/div&gt;) &lt;/div&gt;(&amp;#x201c;ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02&amp;#x201d;&lt;/div&gt;)
 which requires companies to generally recognize on the balance sheet operating and financing lease liabilities and corresponding right-of-use-assets. ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02&lt;/div&gt; also requires improved disclosures to help users of financial statements better understand the amount

 the Company currently anticipates that the adoption of ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02&lt;/div&gt; will have a significant impact on its long-term assets and liabilities
 as
 at a minimum
 virtually all of its leases designated as operating leases in Note &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;9&lt;/div&gt; &amp;#x2013; Commitments and Contingencies

 &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2018&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;02
&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Reclassification of Certain Tax Effects from Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income &lt;/div&gt;that permits a reclassification from accumulated other comprehensive income to retained earnings for stranded tax effects resulting from the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act enacted in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 2017. &lt;/div&gt;The standard is effective for fiscal years beginning after &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 15

 &lt;/div&gt;the FASB issued ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;12
&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Targeted Improvements to Accounting for Hedging Activities&lt;/div&gt;&amp;nbsp;(ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;12&lt;/div&gt;)
 which amends the presentation and disclosure requirements and changes how companies assess effectiveness. The amendments are intended to more closely align hedge accounting with companies&amp;#x2019; risk management strategies
 simplify the application of hedge accounting
 and increase transparency as to the scope and results of hedging programs. ASU &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2017&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;12&lt;/div&gt; is effective for annual periods beginning after &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; December 15
 2018

&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;Financial Instruments &amp;#x2014;Credit Losses (Topic &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;326&lt;/div&gt;): Measurement of Credit Losses on Financial Instruments &lt;/div&gt;(ASU&amp;nbsp;&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;2016&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;13&lt;/div&gt;)

 a portion of which are included in all &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;three&lt;/div&gt; medical areas

 based on the performance requirements of the contract. Non-refundable contract fees for which &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;no&lt;/div&gt; further performance obligations exist

 the Company splits the arrangement into separate units of accounting if the individually delivered elements have value to the customer on a standalone basis. The Company also evaluates whether multiple transactions with the same customer or related party should be considered part of a multiple element arrangement
 whereby the Company assesses
 among other factors
 whether the contracts or agreements are negotiated or executed within a short time frame of each other or if there are indicators that the contracts are negotiated in contemplation of each other. The Company then allocates revenue to each element based on a selling price hierarchy. The relative selling price for a deliverable is based on its vendor-specific objective evidence (&amp;#x201c;VSOE&amp;#x201d;)
 if available
 &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;third&lt;/div&gt;-party evidence (&amp;#x201c;TPE&amp;#x201d;)
 if VSOE is &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; available
 or estimated selling price
 if neither VSOE nor TPE is available. The Company then recognizes revenue on each deliverable in accordance with its policies for product and service revenue recognition. The Company is &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; typically able to determine VSOE or TPE
 and therefore

 and for an arrangement that includes a general right of return relative to the delivered products or services
 delivery or performance of the undelivered product or service is considered probable and is substantially controlled by the Company. The Company considers a deliverable to have stand-alone value if the product or service is sold separately by the Company or another vendor or could be resold by the customer. Further
 the revenue arrangements generally do &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; include a general right of return relative to delivered products. Where the aforementioned criteria for a separate unit of accounting are &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; met
 the deliverable is combined with the undelivered element(s) and treated as a single unit of accounting for the purposes of allocation of the arrangement consideration and revenue recognition. The Company allocates the total arrangement consideration to each separable element of an arrangement based upon the relative selling price of each element. Allocation of the consideration is determined at arrangement inception on the basis of each unit&amp;#x2019;s relative selling price. In instances where the Company has &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; established fair value for any undelivered element

 the initial license fees are deferred and amortized to revenue over the period of the agreement when a contract exists
 the fee is fixed and determinable
 and collectability is reasonably assured. Noncancellable
 nonrefundable license fees are recognized over the period of the agreement

 the Company offers customers sales incentives

 and City National Bank (&amp;#x201c;CNB&amp;#x201d;); due in quarterly principal and interest payments of $1
250 beginning December 1
 2016 through September 23
 2021 with the remainder due on maturity

 &lt;/div&gt;the Company managed its business operations through &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;three&lt;/div&gt; strategic business units based upon the information reported to the chief operating decision maker
 who is the Chief Executive Officer: Packaged Fresh Vegetables
 Food Export and Biomaterials. However
 in &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 2018
 &lt;/div&gt;the Company discontinued its Food Export business segment. As a result
 the Company met the requirements of ASC &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;205&lt;/div&gt;-&lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;20&lt;/div&gt; and ASC &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;360&lt;/div&gt; to report the results of the Food Export business segment as discontinued operations. The operating results for the Food Export business segment
 in all periods presented

 the majority of which incorporate the BreatheWay specialty packaging for the retail grocery
 club store and food services industry. In addition
 the Packaged Fresh Vegetables segment sells BreatheWay packaging to partners for fruit and vegetable products. The Biomaterials segment sells products utilizing hyaluronan
 a naturally occurring polysaccharide that is widely distributed in the extracellular matrix of connective tissues in both animals and humans
 and non-HA products for medical use primarily in the Ophthalmic
 Orthopedic and other markets. Other includes licensing and R&amp;amp;D activities from Landec&amp;#x2019;s Intelimer polymers for agricultural products
 personal care products and other industrial products and from the operations of the &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic;&gt;O&lt;/div&gt; business from its acquisition date of &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; March 1
 2017 &lt;/div&gt;through &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; May 27
 2018. &lt;/div&gt;The Other segment also includes corporate general and administrative expenses

The timing and actual number of shares repurchased is at the discretion of management of the Company and will depend on a variety of factors
 including stock price
 corporate and regulatory requirements
 market conditions
 the relative attractiveness of other capital deployment opportunities and other corporate priorities. The stock repurchase program does &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt;not&lt;/div&gt; obligate Landec to acquire any amount of its Common Stock and the program &lt;div style=display: inline; font-style: italic; font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;&gt; may &lt;/div&gt;be modified

							function toggleNextSibling (e) {
							if (e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
							} else { e.nextSibling.style.display='none'; }
